definition: to give birth (animals)/to bear a litter
meticulous/(of domestic animals or fowls) young

sentences.english: Duroc are more likely to be over conditioned at farrowing time.
sentences.chinese: 杜洛克的体况在产仔时更容易掉膘。

sentences.english: Reproduction of Tibetan monkeys troop in Yulingkeng of Huangshan Mountain wasseasonality, and it belongs to the birth rhythm pattern.
sentences.chinese: 黄山短尾猴鱼鳞坑群为季节性繁殖，属产仔节律型。

sentences.english: A sand tiger shark off the Bonin Islands will soon give birth.
sentences.chinese: 小笠原群岛外，一只虎头鲨即将产仔。

sentences.english: Litter size and weight at birth was lower than control (P<0.05).
sentences.chinese: 产仔初生重低于空白对照组，窝产仔数下降。

sentences.english: Litter size and weight at birth was lower than control (P<0.05).
sentences.chinese: 产仔初生重低于空白对照组，窝产仔数下降。

sentences.english: The wolf littered in a deserted farmhouse.
sentences.chinese: 狼在一个没人居住的农家房子产仔。

sentences.english: The number of piglets per litter must be lower then?
sentences.chinese: 那窝产仔数肯定会低一些了？

sentences.english: The mice were then returned to normal conditions, where they grew up and had offspring.
sentences.chinese: 随后，老鼠们回归了原始的生活环境，并生长产仔。

sentences.english: Some animals will not breed when caged.
sentences.chinese: 有些动物关在笼内就不产仔。

sentences.english: The whales calve at this time of year.
sentences.chinese: 鲸鱼在每年的这个时候产仔。

definition: (of animals) to give birth/to foal, to whelp etc
variant of 仔豬|仔猪[zi3 zhu1]
to forage/to gather for eating/to pick and eat
